headline: Fitzpatrick to go to Ukraine border: 'We're just horrified at the images'
author: Peg Quann
sentences: The delegation also wants to talk to Poles and others who are trying to help the Ukrainians to see why there are delays in them getting all the weapons and supplies they need to improve their defenses and to deal with a Russian convoy that has been sitting on an open road leading to the capital, Kyiv.

Before President Joe Biden's State of the Union speech Tuesday, he said in an interview that the United States needed to do more to stop the flow of Russian oil to this country and to help the Ukrainians obtain weaponry to control their skies.

Congressman Brian Fitzpatrick will join five other members of Congress in flying to Europe on Friday to visit the Ukrainian border to see first-hand the issues facing Ukraine's forces in defending their country from the Russian invasion.

More:Fitzpatrick on Ukraine: US needs to cut imports of Russian fuel; do more to help Ukrainians
"We're just horrified at the images we're seeing...We want to go over there and see what's going on," he said on "Fox & Friends."
Fitzpatrick, R-01 of Middletown, said the issues are "very personal to me," because of the time he spent in Ukraine as an FBI agent and his concern for friends in the government there.
On Thursday morning, he said he couldn't say more about the trip for security reasons but would have more to report when he got back to the United States.
He now serves as co-chair of the Ukraine and Ukrainian-American Caucus in the House of Representatives.
He compared Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to "a modern-day Churchill galvanizing the world."
He made the announcement during a televised interview on "Fox & Friends" Thursday morning.
To contact Peg Quann, email mquann@couriertimes.com.
